revised_title: Artificial Tannin Production and Coal Formation: A Study on Roasted Vegetable Substances
tldr: This article discusses experiments conducted by Charles Hatchett on the effects of sulfuric acid on various resins, balsams, and gums. He discovered that roasted vegetable substances can be converted into an artificial tanning substance through a series of chemical reactions. The study also explores the connection between tannin and coal formation, as well as the process of converting different types of coal into the tanning substance using nitric acid.
